NewsItems.Summary: The AMLOcl Editor Plugin is released to be used with licensed editor versions 6.1.6 and beyond.

Links.LinkTarget: AutomationML Editor Plugin AMLOcl on NUGET

NewsItems.Summary: A new library relations view showing a library dependency graph is ready to use.
NewsItems.More: Classes and Types in a library can have references to classes and types in other libraries. The relations view shows a library dependeny graph for a single library or the full document. You are invited to comment on this announcement.

NewsItems.Summary: There are new wiki pages with explanatory videos for some specific editor functions.
Problem, related to the Aml.Engine and DocumentVersion Information
NewsItems.More: If you are using the Aml.Engine to read DocumentVersion Information included in a CAEXFile youn should know, that the engine has implemented two different model structures. See the linked information.

NewsItems.Summary: A new sandbox repository to support the plugin development for AutomationML editor version 6.0 and higher is now available.
NewsItems.More: Please note that both the version for the editor in version 5 and the new version for the editor in version 6 are offered.

NewsItems.Summary: AML software support by Josef Prinz ended
NewsItems.More: I will no longer be involved in the further development and maintenance of the AutomationML software components. You may continue to contact me for bug fixes.

Links.LinkTarget: AutomationML software support by Josef Prinz.

NewsItems.Summary: AutomationML Engine Updates
NewsItems.More: The API online documentation has moved to a new web location and there are brand new wiki pages with more code examples (see below).

Links.LinkTarget: Picture of the complete CAEX Class Model
Working with external libraries and classes
Using Indices to speed up queries
Access elements of structured attributes using the AMLEngine

NewsItems.Summary: You are invited to share your ideas or proposals for new features of the AutomationML editor in a new discussion forum provided by GitHub.
The AML Engine now offers a TreeTraversal Service. This service offers Breadth First and Depth First methods for traversing InternalElement hierarchies.
New series about plugin development.
NewsItems.More: The development of plugins for the AutomationML editor will be presented step by step in a series of blog posts with concrete example implementations.  The finished plugins will be published afterwards.

NewsItems.Summary: The AML Engine repository on GitHub now contains a complete API documentation and a new Wiki.
The project page for the development of plugins for the AutomationML editor has been updated. The sample implementations include a procedure for plugin deployment under NUGET.
AutomationML Position Paper on Implementation Technologies for the Asset Administration Shell.
NewsItems.More: Industrie 4.0 experts are currently involved in implementation efforts for the Asset Administration Shell, a core concept for the envisioned digitalised industry. A panel of experts under the umbrella of the AutomationML e.V. has formulated a paper presenting their recommendations for the implementation technologies for Industrie 4.0 scenarios involving the Asset Administration Shell.

NewsItems.Summary: PlugIn developers can test the integration of their own PlugIns from a local Nuget folder before publishing them to the NUGET platform. The procedure can be followed in the development environment for PlugIns.

Links.LinkTarget: AutomationML Editor PlugIn Resources on GitHub

NewsItems.Summary: AutomationML Software Development by example.
NewsItems.More: AutomationML provides sample implementations for basic technologies and methods that can be used to work with XML-based data models.

Links.LinkTarget: Example code of the AML Book
Git repository of the AMLEngine with sample code
AutomationML cook book chapter about AML software development.

NewsItems.Summary: AutomationML Import and Export Programming.
NewsItems.More: A guidance for programming AutomationML export and import software interfaces. The importing software interface (Importer) therefore needs an assignment strategy and a mapping rule for the semantically unique transformation of the AutomationML object into the target engineering tool in order to ensure a lossless data transfer. By means of a basic software architecture we show how the transformation works and describe which concepts and strategies can be used to successfully implement export/import interfaces.

Links.LinkTarget: Git repository: AutomationML example import and export implementations.
AutomationML cook book chapter about AML software development.

NewsItems.Summary: New AutomationML Icon Library is available.
NewsItems.More: The new AutomationML Icon Library will be used in the next version of the AutomationML Editor (v. 5.5.0). Compared to previous versions, this one is more readable and easier to integrate into software. All icons are vector graphics and available in different formats (.svg, .png, .pdf, .xaml).

NewsItems.Summary: Our new website is now online and presents itself in a contemporary, fresh and completely renewed design.
NewsItems.More: With a fresh and completly new design the AutomationML site is significantly more modern, clearer and more user-friendly than before. It also offers users extensive information about AutomationML, the AutomationML Association, its members and its publications. In addition, there is supplementary content on the AutomationML books, which you can find on our new webpage. Links to the chapters are also published in the AMLBook section here.

NewsItems.Summary: Along with the 15. birthday of AutomationML, the new AutomationML books for the global community are finally published.
NewsItems.More: The textbook is written for students and lecturers explaining the innovations and basic concepts of AutomationML and the AutomationML Editor. The cookbook provides recipes for AML software implementations and how to model various industrial use cases, for example the Modelling of AAS, MTP, SCD, OPC UA, Automation Components, Automation Projects, drive configurations, requirement models, communication systems, electrical interfaces and cables, or semantic integration aspects as eClass integration or handling of semantic heterogeneity.

NewsItems.Summary: Best Practice Recommendation CC-Link is available
NewsItems.More: This Best Practice Recommendation describes classes that are needed to describe CC-Link related networks and their devices. The definitions of this document can be combined with other existing modelling concepts.

NewsItems.Summary: AutomationML libraries for Part 4 have been withdrawn.
NewsItems.More: AutomationML libraries of part 4 of AutomationML Edition 1 with version number 2.2.2 contain non-standardized classes. This version is now marked as not verified in the editor. Users can revert to version 2.2.1. The new published standardized libraries of part 4 are to be used for the logic models. New libraries will be supported by release 6.2.0 of AutomationML editor.
